title: Russian space chief says new rocket will put Falcon 9 reuse to shame
Switzerland signs Artemis Accords
summary: Switzerland formally signed the Artemis Accords April 16, becoming the latest nation to join an agreement about sustainable space exploration.

title: Unforgiving Failures: the challenges of upper stages
summary: Among Western launch vehicles alone there were five partial or complete failures on orbital launches in 2023 (six when counting the second, suborbital test flight of SpaceX’s Starship in November.)

title: Can companies clean up by cleaning up space?
summary: The satellite industry would seem to have nearly a billion reasons to embrace satellite servicing. But the insurers who are on the hook for massive claims are taking a far more cautious approach.

title: Orbital Defence Startup Dark Secures $6M in Additional Funding
summary: Paris-based space startup Dark has announced the closure of a $6 million seed extension round. The company has now raised over $11 million to...

title: NASA Wants New Ideas — Fast — on How to Return Samples from Mars Affordably
summary: After months of analysis, NASA said today it agrees with the results of last year’s Independent Review Board that concluded the Mars Sample Return mission plan needs a do-over. That […]

title: NASA Agrees ISS Debris Hit Home in Florida
summary: NASA confirmed today that a piece of debris from the International Space Station hit a home in Naples, FL last month.  The homeowner reported that something hit his house about […]

title: NASA to look for new options to carry out Mars Sample Return program
summary: NASA will seek “out of the box” ideas in a bid to reduce the costs and shorten the schedule for returning samples from Mars.

title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX to reach its 40th Falcon 9 flight of 2024
summary: With seven Falcon 9 launches flown this month already, SpaceX’s rapid pace continues with another three flights planned for this coming week. There are two planned launches on Wednesday, April 17, from both the east and west coasts, and another on Thursday, April 18. Additionally, a Chinese Chang Zheng 2D launched on Monday.

title: Smallsat maker Aerospacelab snaps up spacecraft optics specialist
summary: Six-year-old European small satellite maker Aerospacelab has bought AMOS, a Belgian company that has provided optics for spacecraft and ground-based telescopes for more than four decades.
